lead_paragraph: Three months after Representative Sonny Bono's death in a skiing accident, his widow, Mary, easily won a special election on Tuesday to succeed him in Congress, defeating her nearest Democratic rival, the actor Ralph Waite, by more than 2 to 1. ''I know that Sonny would be extremely proud of the campaign that we have run,'' Mrs. Bono, a 36-year-old Republican political neophyte told supporters in Palm Springs, where Mr. Bono began his political career as Mayor. ''I know because I spent 14 years with Sonny.''
abstract: Rep Sonny Bono's widow, Mary, easily wins special election to succeed him in Congress, defeating her nearest Democratic rival, actor Ralph Waite, by more than 2 to 1; State Sen Barbara Lee, Democrat, easily wins Ninth Congressional seat in Alameda County held since 1970 by her mentor, Ronald V Dellums, who retired; photo (M)

headline.main: Sonny Bono's Widow Chosen To Succeed Him in Congress
